conclusion: Analyze forces on blocks A and B to find mass ratio.
Block B is pushed by a horizontal force and is in close contact with block A.
Contact surface between A and B is vertical.
Block A is on a horizontal ground.
Friction force on B is at maximum: f = μ1 N.
Gravitational force on B equals friction force: mB g = μ1 N.
Normal force on B: N = mB g / μ1.
Friction force on A: f = μ2 (mA g + N).
Combine equations: mB g = μ2 (mA g + mB g / μ1).
Solve for mass ratio: mB = μ2 mA + μ2 mB / μ1.
Clear fraction: μ1 mB = μ1 μ2 mA + μ2 mB.
Combine terms: mB (μ1 - μ2) = μ1 μ2 mA.
Final mass ratio: mA / mB = (μ1 - μ2) / (μ1 μ2).
